title: Climate change: How could a 2050 weather forecast look?
description: The future climate could be determined by the level of emissions in the coming years.

title: Wales secure at least World Cup play-off place after Spain win
description: Wales are officially guaranteed at least a place in the World Cup play-offs after Spain beat Greece 1-0.

title: Lateral flow tests: Americans react to seeing UK rapid testing
description: A British nurse explains how at-home, fast Covid tests changed her life - and what the US can expect.

title: Wade hits three successive sixes as Australia stun Pakistan to reach T20 World Cup final
description: Australia come back from the brink to beat Men's T20 World Cup favourites Pakistan by five wickets in another absorbing semi-final in Dubai.

title: Sao Paulo Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton says 'every race a must-win' in battle with Max Verstappen
description: Lewis Hamilton says "every race is a must-win" as his title battle with Max Verstappen heads into its climax.

title: FW de Klerk: The man who still divides South Africa
description: Was he a visionary who ended a racist system, or should he have been prosecuted?

title: Quiz of the week: Which actor destroyed an original Banksy?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Plasma donation: 'Why your blood matters so much to me'
description: Cancer survivor Luke tells us how he benefits from plasma, as the NHS calls for 5,000 more donors.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan's Hafeez bowls 'horrendous' double-bouncer at Warner
description: Mohammad Hafeez produces "a comedy moment" as he bowls a double-bouncer that's hit for six by David Warner in the Men's T20 World Cup semi-final match between Pakistan and Australia.

title: Poland-Belarus crisis: The lives caught in a stalemate
description: A row over an influx of migrants has reached a stalemate. We spoke to people caught in the middle.

title: COP26: Barack Obama praises Nandi Bushell's climate change song
description: Drummer Nandi Bushell says a Facebook post from the former US president is "incredible".

title: My Day at COP26: 'Anything we achieve in Glasgow is not going to be enough'
description: Bangladeshi climate scientist, Saleemul Huq, is at COP26 to advise the world’s least developed countries. He describes the mood as the summit nears its conclusion.

title: Drink spiking: What's being done to stop it?
description: From helping charge your phone in clubs to wristband testing kits, here are some changes being made.

title: Smith starts at 10 for England v Australia with Tuilagi on wing
description: Marcus Smith will start at 10 for England, with captain Owen Farrell at 12, against Australia on Saturday.

title: FW de Klerk: South Africa's former president dies at 85
description: FW de Klerk was the last white person to lead the nation and was key in the transition to democracy.

title: MPs criticised for 'drunkenness' on Gibraltar Armistice Day trip
description: The defence secretary accuses three MPs of "undermining respect for Parliament" over their alleged behaviour.

title: Armistice Day: UK gathers for remembrance of deaths in military conflicts
description: People are holding public remembrance ceremonies together once more, after last year's lockdown.

title: Meghan apologises to court for biography exchanges
description: The Duchess of Sussex says she did not remember exchanges with an aide over the Finding Freedom book.

title: 'Yorkshire racism has fractured game' - England captain Root
description: England Test captain Joe Root says the racism scandal at his county side Yorkshire has "fractured our game and torn lives apart".

title: UK economic growth slows as supply problems hit the recovery
description: The economy grew by 1.3% between July and September, with supply chain problems hitting businesses.

title: Steven Gerrard: Aston Villa name Rangers boss as new manager
description: Steven Gerrard has become the new Aston Villa manager - leaving Scottish champions Rangers after three years in charge.

title: 'It's coming' - Murray eyes more success after showing he can compete at top level again
description: Andy Murray beats top seed Jannik Sinner to reach the Stockholm Open quarter-finals and says it settles the debate over whether he can compete at the top level again.

title: COP26: How can an average family afford an electric car? And more questions
description: BBC correspondents answer your questions about Glasgow's COP26 climate summit.

title: We must do better over MP standards, says Chancellor Rishi Sunak
description: The chancellor says conduct rules should be "followed to the letter" amid ongoing sleaze allegations.

title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: Husband Richard on hunger strike to urge government to help
description: Richard Ratcliffe, the husband of Iranian detainee Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, is weeks into his protest.

title: Ambulance patients at risk on every shift, says paramedic
description: Targets are missed across UK - with some heart attack and stroke victims waiting up to nine hours for help.

title: Alec Baldwin film tragedy: Crew member sues for negligence
description: An electrician alleges negligence in the incident in which cinematographer Halyna Hutchins died.

title: Patrice Evra says taking the knee won’t stop racism in sport
description: The will is not there to tackle prejudice, the former professional footballer Patrice Evra says.

title: COP26: US-China climate agreement and fossil fuel spending
description: Five things you need to know about COP26 - the United Nations climate change conference - on Thursday.

title: The secrecy behind a wartime disaster at sea
description: Aircraft carrier HMS Dasher exploded in 1943 killing 379 but the disaster was covered up during the war.

title: Spitfire found in peatbog slowly being pieced back together
description: Flown from Scotland on a clandestine mission, enthusiasts hope the shot down aircraft might fly again.

title: The Papers: MP's £6m second job and Meghan says sorry to court
description: The papers cover the controversy over MPs' outside interests and the Duchess of Sussex's court case.

title: Watch as hot air balloonist breaks world record
description: Rémi Ouvrard stood on top of a hot air balloon at more than 3,500m over western France.

title: 'To reach 100 caps is unreal' - the real Bale by some of those who know him best
description: Schoolmates, room-mates, fellow players and former managers pay tribute to Gareth Bale as he prepares to win his 100th Wales cap.

title: Coastal saltmarsh 'engineered' to fight climate change
description: Re-flooding coastal wetlands could provide an opportunity to 'use sea level' rise to fight climate change

title: Hundreds with rare diseases get diagnosis for first time
description: The new approach could lead to better treatments for those waiting years for answers.

title: The man turning cities into giant sponges to embrace floods
description: Yu Kongjian's sponge city, based on ancient Chinese wisdom, seeks to change how we deal with floods.

title: COP26: Climate activists on what change means for them
description: Climate activists from the Philippines, the UK and Argentina take questions on climate change.

title: Mental health: ‘Do we ever see our role models cry?’
description: Following a friend's suicide, Andy Bishop, set up ManGang, a support group to help get men talking.

title: Himalayan village split in two by climate change
description: In Kumik, in India's northern Ladakh region, there is a serious water crisis, with some residents forced to abandon their homes and move elsewhere.

title: The African migrants running a food bank in Sicily
description: Undocumented people in Italy struggling for money during the Covid pandemic are not entitled to aid.

title: Belarus migrants: What routes do they use to reach Minsk?
description: The migrant crisis along the EU's borders is the result of increasing numbers arriving in Belarus by air.

title: Would the world be better if it was run by teenagers?
description: One energy firm has appointed an advisory board of six young people to help guide the business.
